item.description:
Please note that this hike is being held in conjunction with the 4 Seasons Hiking Group. There is no need to sign up with both groups.

This hike will start at the Nineteen-Mile Brook Trailhead on Route 16 just north of the Mount Washington Auto Road.
Please read the below carefully prior to signing up. Know your abilities. Microspikes are required. Winter clothing is also required.
All attendees must read, understand and agree to the Hikers responsibility code and waiver/liability listed on this web site.
Hikers must be able to hike at a pace of two miles an hour non stop for a minimum of two hours.
Leaving NH 16, the trail follows the northeast bank of Nineteen-Mile Brook on the remains of an old road. The main trail passes a dam in the brook, and the Carter Dome Trail diverges left for Zeta Pass.
to the junction of Carter Dome Trail
hike 1.70 mi/1 hr 24 min/+1072 ft on the Nineteen-Mile Brook Trail
Here the Nineteen-Mile Brook Trail crosses a tributary on a footbridge, and it crosses another brook at a small cascade, also on a footbridge. The trail crosses a small brook and begins to ascend more steeply to the height-of-land, where the Wildcat Ridge Trail diverges right (west).
to the junction of Wildcat Ridge Trail
hike 0.14 mi/4 min/-110 ft on the Nineteen-Mile Brook Trail
The Nineteen-Mile Brook Trail then drops steeply to the larger Carter Lake, passes the Carter-Moriah Trail left.
to the junction of Carter-Moriah Trail
hike 0.06 mi/2 min/+10 ft on the Nineteen-Mile Brook Trail
Here, the trail crosses between the lakes, and reaches Carter Notch Hut and the junction with the Wildcat River Trail.
to AMC Carter Notch Hut
Totals
Distance 3.80 mi
Time 2 hr 53 min
Elev Gain +1991 ft
Elev Loss -175 ft
Elev Change +1815 ft
Driving Directions
Show in Google Earth
Download to GPS
Back to here hike 0.06 mi/2 min/-10 ft on the Nineteen-Mile Brook Trail
From the Wildcat River Trail, the trail reaches Carter Notch Hut then crosses between the lakes.
to the junction of Carter-Moriah Trail
hike 1.20 mi/36 min/+1539 ft on the Carter-Moriah Trail
The trail begins on the Nineteen-Mile Brook Trail at the shore of the larger Carter Lake, north of Carter Notch Hut. It climbs very steeply at first, then moderates, and a side path leads 30 yd. to the right to an excellent outlook over Carter Notch. The trail continues to climb at a moderate grade, passing a side path that leads to the left 60 yd. to a fine spring, and it reaches the partly open summit of Carter Dome, where the Rainbow Trail enters on the right.
to Carter Dome
Totals
Distance 5.06 mi
Time 3 hr 31 min
Elev Gain +3537 ft
Elev Loss -193 ft
Elev Change +3344 ft
Driving Directions
Show in Google Earth
Download to GPS
Back to here hike 0.39 mi/18 min/-222 ft on the Carter-Moriah Trail
The Carter-Moriah Trail descends steadily, and the Black Angel Trail enters on the right.
to the junction of Black Angel Trail and Carter Dome Trail
hike 0.01 mi/1 min/-28 ft on the Carter-Moriah Trail
In another 25 yd., as the Carter Dome Trail continues straight ahead, the Carter-Moriah Trail bears right, passes through a shallow sag, and ascends moderately to the summit of Mt. Hight.
to the junction of Carter Dome Trail
hike 0.40 mi/13 min/+93 ft on the Carter-Moriah Trail
At this bare summit, which commands the best views in the range, the trail makes a very sharp left turn; great care must be exercised to stay on the trail if visibility is poor, particularly going north, because a beaten path that soon peters out continues north from the summit.
to Mt Hight
Totals
Distance 5.86 mi
Time 4 hr 3 min
Elev Gain +3680 ft
Elev Loss -493 ft
Elev Change +3188 ft
Driving Directions
Show in Google Earth
Download to GPS
Back to here hike 0.40 mi/30 min/-616 ft on the Carter-Moriah Trail
The trail descends steeply and rejoins the Carter Dome Trail.
to the junction of Carter Dome Trail
hike 0.20 mi/11 min/-147 ft on the Carter-Moriah Trail
The two trails continue to Zeta Pass, where the Carter Dome Trail turns left and descends toward NH 16. Water may occasionally be available in a small stream (usually dry in midsummer) that is accessible from the Carter Dome Trail 80 yd. below this junction.
to Zeta Pass
hike 1.90 mi/1 hr 47 min/-1582 ft on the Carter Dome Trail
The Carter Dome Trail leaves Carter-Moriah Trail at Zeta Pass. It passes a good spring right then descends by a series of seven switchbacks. It crosses a tributary of the Nineteen-Mile Brook at a small, attractive cascade. It recrosses the brook and arrives at the Nineteen-Mile Brook Trail.
to the junction of Nineteen-Mile Brook Trail
hike 1.90 mi/1 hr 23 min/-843 ft on the Nineteen-Mile Brook Trail
The trail follows the northeast bank of Nineteen-Mile Brook on the remains of an old road. The trail passes a dam in the brook, and the Carter Dome Trail diverges right for Zeta Pass then the main trail arrives at NH 16.
to Nineteen-Mile Brook Trailhead
Totals
Distance 10.26 mi
Time 7 hr 54 min
Elev Gain +3795 ft
Elev Loss -3795 ft
Elev Change 0 ft
item.how_to_find_us: Dianne and I will be in a Black Four Door Echo with Maine Plates
item.name: Carter Dome
